text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to explain that establishing actual occupation requires a degree of continuity and permanence. The candidate answer discusses the impact of the temporary absence abroad on the user's rights, stating, \"Going abroad for a few months does not automatically mean you have surrendered the room\u2014especially if: - your belongings are still there, - you intend to return, - you kept keys / access, - you didn\u2019t give notice or agree to end your occupation.\" While this touches upon the temporary nature of the absence versus the permanence of occupation, it does not explicitly state the legal principle that \"to establish actual occupation there must be a degree of continuity and permanence of occupation\" as a standalone legal explanation required by the rubric criterion. It frames it as a factor in determining surrender/abandonment rather than defining the core concept of actual occupation itself.", "criterion_id": "f0fffa23-151f-4433-8cbb-1f2067b841d8"}
